comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> Administrator rights are required to install or update.

Can you use elevated rights to install?

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Elevated rights should not be required when you specify `-Scope CurrentUser`.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
Also, the `Install-Module` command is hosted in https://github.com/powershell/powershellget/issues, so the issue should probably be filed over there.
GitHub
PowerShell/PowerShellGet
PowerShellGet is the Package Manager for PowerShell - PowerShell/PowerShellGet

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
BTW `PowerShellGet` is in the process of getting a major upgrade. That effort is in "preview" right now. You might try taking the new version for a spin assuming you can get it installed using `Install-Module`. https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/powershellget-3-0-preview-3/ I would execute the suggested command to install the preview version of PowerShellGet in an elevated console. After that, from a non-elevated console try installing posh-git again like so: ``` Install-PSResource posh-git -Scope CurrentUser -Verbose ```
PowerShell
PowerShellGet 3.0 Preview 3 | PowerShell
PowerShellGet 3.0 preview 3 is now available on the PowerShell Gallery. The focus of this release is the -RequiredResource parameter for Install-PSResource which now allows for json, hashtable, or .json files as input. For a full list of the issues addressed by this release please refer to this GitHub project.
